lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I cast my Skywrite spell-- ew, I just spit-- and I use the smoke in the distance and as it's rising up into the sky, start drawing out the de Rolo family crest in the smoke.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You begin to take the plume of smoke and filter into the dark rain clouds and you make the smoke go to a thicker, thicker black and take the next few moments to begin sculpting in the air until eventually we have a very well-defined de Rolo crest now staring down at the entire city of Whitestone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Something's happening! Something's happening in the sky!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Something-- I must flee! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Investigation checks from both of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did I find anything on Smash-Face?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (sighs) That's what you rolled the last time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got to put this one away for a while.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled a nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The two of you take a while upstairs looking about the rooms. You manage to acquire from just some of the local bits of cabinets and dust, you gather about 230 gold pieces.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a nice jewelry box that seems to contain most of the jewels and gems that this individual likes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to take the whole jewelry box and sort through it later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So say a box of Tylieri's jewelry would be what you've marked down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That won't be confusing at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. You do notice, however, that's all you're able to find for the most part, other than some few bits of clothing and outfit. The master bedroom has no bed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does he sleep in a coffin?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to finish searching downstairs and then find the entrance to the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to wind my way up there, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you make your way up there you notice them stepping out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I'm still curious. I want to go have a look as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Investigation.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's better, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16? You look through the room. Most everything of interest has already been picked clean. This room also doesn't seem to see much use other than the clothing that's in there. This room is used for dressing and presentational purposes but other than that, as a bedroom, it's pretty useless. As you guys go downstairs, we'll say for the sake of brevity you take a little bit of time to start looking through. You know you're a little pressed for time because you can feel the energy in the town begin to rise and you start hearing noises. You keeping an eye out?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The people that rush into the rooms are now rushing back out, some of them wearing leather tunics and small bits of armor, their weapons gathered, and they're forming small bands.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I come over the speakers once again, the ear pieces. "I think it's time to go. Whenever you "guys are ready, I want to light this bitch up."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We need to check all the rooms that go downstairs first.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, quick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Got an empty house." I run out to the door to the left. To the uncovered areas.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It leads into what looks like a small study or some sort of an office room. A big blue rug, a desk with a chair, some papers strewn about.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I grab the rug and yank it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, pull the rug off, reveals a hatch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (excited shouting) I found a hatch!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (cries out in pain) No need to yell!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh sorry. (quieter) I found a hatch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Quick, I just want to do a quick round of the downstairs room before going to the hatch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And then beyond that, you find a room that's pretty bland, with a staircase that leads down into what was once servants' quarters that has been converted into a torture room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, lovely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a little nicer in its presentation and tools than the duergar torture room that you encountered in the Underdark, but this looks to be like Tylieri had a definite interest in entertaining unwanted guests.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vax or Vex, will you come check this hatch for boobies? (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I jog on down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. That's a 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it does not appear to be trapped.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No boobies.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. You want to open that, big guy?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! (growls)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (vroom) The hatch comes up. There is no ladder; it's just a ten-foot drop down into a basement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, I jump.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's very musty. However, you do see in the far corner there is a pad of fresh earth set up, and there is a dark box.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Um.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About eight feet long.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With the Flametongue dagger out for light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The room lights up a little bit and you can see across the way there is a not super-detailed, but a fairly well-crafted coffin on the opposite side of the room.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh! I bet there's treasure in there!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You might be right. Yeah, let's go have a look.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there treasure? Did you find treasure?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The coffin does not appear to be trapped?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I open it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He said that with a question mark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's always fun to do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, should I just smash it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I really feel like this could be--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Smash it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three, two. Grog smashes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Little bit. Or try to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (boof) The lid flies off and then slams on the ground. A smell hits you that's just like musty old mildewed earth. The inside of the coffin is, it's lined with like a fine purplish velvet material, the smell quickly fades. It looks like there are some small baubles in there, keepsakes. There is what looks to be a cape or a cloak that is laid across the bottom of this for comfort.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roll it up. Put it into my satchel. I'm going to take a dagger out and I want to cut all the way up through that purple velvet. Just see, just in case.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rummage through underneath. It appears to be the back of the box.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to check his desk upstairs for anything interesting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Want to make an investigation check?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So when it comes to, you know, enchanting a teleportation circle permanently somewhere or for traps or things-- not actual objects but actually enchanting anything made of stonework. It's easier to enchant, and that's why the whitestone of this area is sought after and a good trade element. So there's notes about that. But the stone trade has been halted, all stone has continued to be mined, but it's not being transported.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is the desk made out of the stone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, there's just notes about it. So all the whitestone that is being mined is not being exported. It's being kept here, somewhere.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're making something big.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're making something big.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we need to get out of here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was going to ask, are you good with the coffin?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. I smash the shit out of it, in an effort to see what's underneath.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It got scattered by druid Sunbeam and destroyed, and the coffin is left in ruins. You do-- even you, Grog-- absorb the fact that when a vampire goes to mist form, you get the feeling that this is the home it needs to come to, to try and survive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not anymore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not anymore. Not that one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I see anyone coming?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh. You see another zombie giant coming up the way. You can see people attacking it, it's just thrashing them about, but this one seems less bothered by the group and is now moving towards a specific area, moving towards the fiery plume in the distance. They're all gathering in that direction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But no one seems to be rushing towards this house?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not at the moment, no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This one's not on fire. Yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you all gather, you can hear the rainstorm itself is coming down in sheets. What do you want to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Light this candle!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we light this on fire, too?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Burn it to the ground.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Everyone out." And I start casting a Flaming Sphere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're out by now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everyone out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys all step out into the rain (whooshes) pouring down. What bits of guard blood that have been pressed against you washes off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I peek in this foyer. And just (boof), right in the middle, and take a minute to move it all around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A Flaming Sphere begins to corkscrew around this room, up over the banister, up to the upper area, and like an artist, you paint this entire room with flame until the entire interior of this main foyer is just an inferno. You can hear the flames licking and the light is very bright. You end up backing up and you can see people, unarmored folk in nearby homes that are pressed up against their windows watching this happen and whispering to each other. The children, those that are kept guarded and are not part of this rebellion, they are watching this with smiles.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Head back to the curiosity shop.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, sneaky, stealthing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you guys run off into the alley behind--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pass Without a Trace I cast on all of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. How many more spells do you have at that level? Because you used it several times today.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a 1st-level. 2nd-level, but I'm fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Back to the alcove, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A quick break, I know I always say that, I'm not going to say five minutes, but.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This one's a real quick break.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll take it real quick because we want to try and get through as much of the story before we get to Critmas.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Critmas!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Critmas! Crimmas.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh dear god.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's going to be a thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is going to, which is going to take some time tonight. Be back here in a few minutes guys, we'll see you in a sec.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pizza! [break]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. So. Jumping back into the chaos, the party has scattered back into the rainstorm. I would like everyone to make a stealth check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right. Plus ten for everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I rolled my disadvantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does it matter on a one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total ten?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Total ten. 11.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 11, technically.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you're making your own stealth, though. You're invisible, so just roll twice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So making up for the bounding chaos that is Grog throughout the city, you manage to still make your way largely as a group stealthed to-- are you heading to the alcove, you said?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's where we had our little crash-base set up, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Occasionally, darting past the streets, you see militant occupants of Whitestone: armored, rushing through, shouting orders to each other, some coming back wounded and helping their friends back. The midday rebellion has definitely started, and you get the sense that the initial surprise has been effective, but the longer this runs, the longer this wears on, the more and more of a body count this will be.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seeing the chaos, can I get the Dust of Tracelessness and start trying to sprinkle it behind us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Guys, we should do something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, we really should.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I with these guys yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have not, but you all meet up back at the alcove, communicating over your earpieces. You make your way to the front of the building. The doors are closed and locked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The alcove?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Closed and locked?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll see about that. I'm going to check the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is ten. 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Seems to be a fairly simple lock.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look for an ambush around. Can we look around?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, perceive it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Rooftops? Sides of the building?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check, guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All of us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not you, you haven't gotten there yet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I actually rolled a 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Looking about, there doesn't appear to be any set ambush or anybody else here. You do hear the soft sound of pacing footsteps in the interior.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we knock on the door?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Canvass the building.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can get in there and see who that is. I can go in, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're right on the inside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought it was upstairs, or you said right on the other side of the door?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right on the other side of the door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, for crying out loud. I push past them I just go, Jordana! Jordana, it's us!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, there's a pause and a voice goes, "Who's us?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Crazy grandma!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And Vox Machina. (quietly) Does she know we're called that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. I don't know. (louder) Crazy grandma was staying with you. Crazy peasants.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Allies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Son of a-- nine?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I help?

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Crazy grandma!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Crazy grandma can help!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say since you're backing her failure up, go ahead and make it with disadvantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, you don't have to call it-- that sounds so sad when you say it like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. There's a pause. "Crazy grandma? Come in." You hear the sound of a locking sound and the door opens up ever-so-slightly. A very, very dimly lit interior, there's a small lantern, a hooded lantern across the room. Other than that, you see the shadow of Jordana as she ushers you all in out of the rain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So, hey guess what? It's started.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, apparently." She closes the door behind you, looks out the window that has the curtains closed and goes, "Okay. So. It's underway. It's not safe to be here right now."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Did anyone see you come in?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good. Who are you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "Oh. Well." How about Seeming? This whole time, have we looked like crazy peasants during the battle?

lines.name: MATT, TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We dropped it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We dropped it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You dropped Seeming before all of this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, just making sure Trinket wasn't a donkey that killed the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would've been intense and awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would've been amazing. Donkey eating a vampire head? Aw, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is hard to believe, but this is crazy grandma.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "I'm crazy grandma." I do a crazy eye thing just to show her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I there, Matt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've just now gotten to that point, you see the door closing as you get there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello. Hi. How'd it go?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good work, by the way! That was awesome! I mean, I saw the fire, I don't know what you did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it went well?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I set fire to the place, some shit went down, dinosaurs were harmed, but I know you got the smoke signal and used that to attack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The de Rolos have dinosaurs?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it was me. It's all good, though. I caused a ruckus, that's all I was supposed to do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's it, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What is going on?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We may have just started a revolution.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does he look familiar to you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You don't recognize us, it's not safe to walk these streets for outsiders, so we were using a little bit of trickery. This is us. We're the same people you were dealing with before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vox Machina.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We just need to rest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay. You can rest here, but how long?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Until we're healed, and then we'll go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Overnight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like we should get word out to somebody, though, because--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To what? To hold the revolution?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like everybody's going to die before we even get to the castle!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's the thing. I don't know if this is the time to rest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we don't have any spells.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm okay. We can maybe make do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't make do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You might be cool, but we're fucked.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How about we stay here until 4:00, 5:00 in the morning--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, I'd say you're close to three in the afternoon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we tell the people to like hold off?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need to briefly quell the rebellion?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We started something. We can't stop it now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to be indoors. It doesn't matter what time we go to attack the castle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's spread word. We can spread word. Let's find a few--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we send off a message?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We sparked a hope in people. We now have innocent peasants, people who are not fighters--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you Skywrite something like "attack tomorrow" or "hold"?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we all take off in separate directions and we tell all the peasants we find that are fighting the time that we're going to attack?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aren't there a bunch of zombie stone giants walking around?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well yeah, we'll have to be sneaky about it, but we'll spread the rumors around. I look at Jordana. Joanna?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jordana.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jordana. And I say, can you get word out to people?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "To a few, maybe. I don't want to go outside right now."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't blame you, dear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's let her stay. I say we just rest up and we attack tonight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tonight?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if there isn't a town to defend tonight?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aren't they stronger then?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be indoors, anyway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: First of all, it's raining outside. It's daytime. There's no vampires out there right now, right? They don't like water, do they?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, they don't like running water, in fact they hate running water! I didn't think about that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a lot of running water, though. I think they're all right with rain.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sure they don't like it. In any case, the only thing that our rebels are rebelling against right now are six zombie giants, one of whom I'm pretty sure they killed already. Did I see them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best you could see, that group was doing pretty well and was hacking it down. Lost a few of their number in the process.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did we ever get a count of how many zombie giants there were?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There were six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There were six that you saw while you were doing your overall flight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What, so we go out and fight zombie giants?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, but maybe we could--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why not? We are the most capable people in this town right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. We could go fight zombie giants and then tell everybody to wait.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nah, it's going to fuck us. We've got to rest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you guys say?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I admire this fire in your eyes, but it's so stupid.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we run out and tell people to stop fucking fighting and wait until tomorrow?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They won't. The giants are going to keep smashing them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What time did he say it was?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's about three. We could just do a round of the front courtyard and see what's going on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck! Fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Try and sleep through the night.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. We fight until we absolutely can't fight anymore.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about the people who absolutely need a short rest at the minimum stay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We stay for an hour.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're short-resting right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Rest for an hour.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is going to go on for a while, but the longer we wait indoors, the more people are going to die, and if we're killing people to try and save the masses-- which is how I'm justifying this whole thing, by the way-- I feel like we can't leave the masses to their own devices.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait a second, what about that, what about that cleric, the religious man that you've talked to. Could he get a message out to everybody? What's his name?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: At this point, though, it's chaos.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We literally lit the fire and we can't stop it now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Archibald? Is that his name?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, they're standing up for themselves.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We also, somebody-- there's the point that somebody is informing on us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Someone

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are you talking about, why?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They were ready for us. They knew we were coming.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course they knew we were coming, we killed one of their--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They said there was an informant. They said that there was an informant when we were there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who did?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That guard. He said our contacts were right. Our informant was correct. Somebody is informing on us. It could be you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I insight-check this woman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll insight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I say it? Because I just said, "It could be you." Can I do the same thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go ahead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. That's terrible. Okay. So.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you want to know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best that you can tell, she just looks genuinely scared and is uncomfortable with your presence right now but is letting it happen. She's still getting over the fact that you guys look entirely different than when you first talked to her about staying here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, short rest and then we head out? We do some attacks and--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've never fought a zombie giant before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, but everybody else is doing it. Those peasants are doing it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what I'm saying. Let's see what we're up against. Let's take a breather and let's go pick one off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jordana, do you have any books here on zombie giants?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For the most part, necromancy is not studied in this town. At least, we never had to "deal with it until recently, and we haven't had the opportunity to really study since."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I mean, zombie combined with giants. We've fought zombies and we've fought giants, so I'm assuming it with a vague--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We keep our distance.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How long does it take to recharge Hex, by the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You need a long rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How many Sunbeam hadoukens do you have left, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many hadoukens? As in Sunbeams? I'm done on Sunbeams.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need to rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we get a short rest, how many do you get?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm done. None.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need a long rest to get spells.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: However, if I short rest, I actually haven't burnt any of my animal forms here recently and I can water elemental up, which would also permanently kill them. So I have other defenses that could still take down vampires if we encounter another one. I'm more concerned about these giants right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I'm talking about. They're vampires.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, they're zombies. They're undead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're zombies.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're undead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Those are two different things, huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are two very different things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So what's the plan?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We short rest and get back out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We take a short rest and then exterminate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, join the rebellion or ride around town telling everyone, "quell?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: These giants are killing people left and right; we watched them crush people on our way here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We tell them that they take cover during the night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to roll four hit dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you guys go ahead, use your hit dice to heal up while you're taking your short rest for those who've taken damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Trinket. Can you heal Trinket?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Heal him so much. Does Trinket get... oh, he does get hit dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket technically does not. Trinket requires--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It says he does. It's written down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hit dice?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Also, another strange question: what creates initiative? Initiative is your dexterity modifier?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Plus two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm also currently wearing a Headband of Initiative, which I'd forgotten about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which...?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Gives me plus two to my initiative.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, dear god almighty. Okay. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, Percy, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't mean to be doing this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's great. Just glad you didn't take the Alertness feat. Then things would have gotten stupid.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you healing Trinket?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How much more does he need?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's at 36. He needs 24 more.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, I'm going to be using the Hat of Disguise just because it's probably safe. Does anybody want a Headband of Initiative?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Do you not need it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't wear two things on my head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't have anything on my head.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So you've got plus two to your initiative, and I'm losing plus two to my initiative. It's called a Headband of Initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You already have an eight to your initiative.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's very mystical.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How much time do we have before the sun that is being blocked by the rainclouds goes down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you guys are taking a short rest, about 30 minutes to an hour, so you have about two and a half, three hours before it goes down entirely.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That should give us enough time to do a quick tour. We already know their walking route, and I'm sure that the people are putting up a fight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to give him a level two Cure Wounds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So do 2d8 plus ten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. Me or you. Whoever feels more comfortable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll do it. It was good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: During this rest, if you wanted to spend some time with that cape--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do. I'm going to sniff it and shake it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the most part, it doesn't appear to be enchanted.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I can sing a Song of Rest for all of us.

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah. Do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It gives us all 1d6. That's pretty weak.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, but that's...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's fine. He's got extra hit points; don't worry about it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, Song of Rest just happens, right? Do you get that for free? You might as well, if you don't burn anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Health! Not just anybody. Health! You know you need someone.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (sings) Health!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys have rested up. Through the rest, you occasionally hear voices run by, yelling. As you guys get toward the end of your rest, you hear the (stomping) large heavy footfalls heading nearby. (groaning, crash) A loud, heavy impact, and you hear some short cheers outside.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, he died. That's two down. Splash two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right out front, we hear it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Out front, a little ways off. Not immediately.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we have horses? We don't have any horses, do we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They died.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, they got eaten by harpies.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we go outside and see how they're doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, let's check it out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We go out front.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Time to kill some giant undead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Jordana lets you guys out, locks behind her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we want to split up?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, let's keep together.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Actually, before we go, I ask, do you have any holy symbols at all in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm sorry, no."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nothing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. All those were kept in either of the two temples here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have anything magic that could help me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I already gave you everything of magic that I had here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right. I forgot we took it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit. All right, thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Once we're outside, how far away is that giant that was felled?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear in the distance, (thunder crack) bolt of lightning coming down from the storm, and as it echoes, everyone shakes for a second, look at each other, (cheers) give a cheer of victory. They all hop off the body of the zombie giant and begin darting further in towards the center of the city.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look up. Is my de Rolo symbol still in the sky?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's there. It's dissipating slowly, but it's still there. It's moved a little bit off-axis with the storm.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So that's it for the big houses, right? Just the castle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just the castle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Except we haven't killed the members of one of the houses. By the way, my Song of Rest is a d8.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Awesome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But we haven't killed the last one. Now, the one that you guys killed. What's his name again, Tylieri?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tylieri.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He was a vampire.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because Sylas killed him. Right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then made him a vampire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One would assume.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Didn't he hang him on the Sun Tree?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? No. What? What are you talking about?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. Didn't that guy that we meet...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tylieri was the master of the driver Desmond, who beat him and subjugated him to various forms of torture and abuse before Lord Briarwood took Desmond and, to try and show extension of faith, revealed to Desmond Tylieri hanging from the Sun Tree. That was true.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then he became a vampire. Is that where they're spawning?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. Maybe he was already a vampire and he hung him from the tree just to show--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That doesn't seem right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's head to the Sun Tree, why don't we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's head that direction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Something to us about how when people die in this town. The guy you talked to at the bar?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, we talked to a guy at the bar. What about him?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He said when people die here they don't die.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, yes, we know that, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They come back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They could be-- yes, that could apply, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think this whole damn town-- I think the whole land is cursed. Is what I think.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think that's--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably pretty fair.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we go to the tree?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just to see--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll make our way through the town and look for giants as we make our way to the tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's look for giants. Let's go giant-hunting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right, so from the Alcove, you guys head in a southwestern motion, keeping off the main paths best you can. The main chaos seems to have died down a little bit in this area of the town. You come across another body of a zombie giant, surrounded by what looks like eight bodies of civilians of the town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they all dead, or are they injured?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Sun Tree, at a glance-- roll a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All of us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One. There's a tree!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled a 19, so 29?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If my passive perception's higher than my roll--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Active perception and passive perception-- passive is more something to keep track when you're not actively perceiving. So. Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Keyleth, you pick this out in the rain, and it's hard to see, but from this angle, you see what looks to be eight ropes, currently, just dangling free from the Sun Tree.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The tree is the spawning spot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or maybe one of them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or maybe they cut them down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've got to cut down this tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like the ropes have been cut?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can go closer to inspect it if you want.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're hearing in the distance the (roars) the battle's still raging about 65, 70 feet from you. You get up behind the tree and you take the ropes and inspect it. All the ropes are very finely cut.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. They were cut. They cut them down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They cut their dead down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so the nooses are gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This close, you can see there are loops of rope all over the tree: some very old and weathered and aged, some of them are torn, some of them are cut, but the fresh ones that are the longest currently and that are placed closest to where the bodies were originally there are all very cleanly cut.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we spin around and look and see if there's anything around that looks like-- or look at tracking and see if it looks like somebody cut them down or if they fell on their own?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance around real fast and you can see to the south there is still the battle raging between the zombie giant and the crew of individuals, but you look back where you guys were from, and you see a large series of shapes stepping through the rain, coming from the direction you guys were.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think they cut them down just like Tylieri. I think that this is where they hang them to ripen, and then when they're ready they pluck them off the tree and set them on their way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're having this conversation, you, keeping your eyes forward as he's saying this in your ear, you can see, as the light of the town is slowly beginning to vanish into a sunset--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it still raining?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is still raining. You see ahead of you, coming from the central roadway into the square of the town, what you can only surmise to be anywhere from 30 to 50 armored skeletal entities that are pouring from the north.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I climb the Sun Tree.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, what? We've got to get out of here!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm climbing the Sun Tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Climbing the Sun Tree. All right. You guys see Keyleth scurry up the Sun Tree.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I blow my Horn of Fog to create a smokescreen. I don't know what the fuck she's doing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (foghorn sound) The slow horn-blow comes out, and this fog begins to fill the area between this marching skeletal army and the Sun Tree where you guys currently are. Looking over your shoulder, you can see the zombie giant finishes smashing the last individual in that crew, picks it up and jams it into its jagged giant teeth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So there's a big army coming down, filtering down a street.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Down the street towards you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't tell now. There's just fog along the way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can't tell how far away they are right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you can't see them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can't see them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, because Scanlan just created a whole bunch of fog between the two of you. The moment you saw, they may be about a hundred or so feet from you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keyleth, tell us what you're thinking, because the rest of us are taking this time to go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You engage, they'll follow, we go, we fight another day, we sleep in the rafters and wait until daybreak.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I might be able to do something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it? Say it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can do a big ice storm or do something to take all these fuckers out at once.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All 30 to 50 of them? Kill them all?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a big range.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. Keyleth, we've got to go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I say we let her hit them, and we run.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan, can you drop the fog just a bit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope, not by magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He can't control it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's on the ground. You can probably see above it. Fog is low.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the fog this creates is a magical fog that obscures an entire area. If you climbed to the very top of the tree, you might be able to get a little bit of a visual.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, I'm going to climb as high as I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make an athletics check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to climb up after her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 11. Acrobatics or athletics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Athletics.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's better. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15. Okay. You make your way up to the very precarious top of the branches. You can feel the brittleness of it as the tree itself, its life force is withered over time and some of it cracks and some of the actual bark of the tree twists off in your grip as you get to the very top. You can look just over the bank of fog that Scanlan has created and you can see beyond that. The number of undead from this angle, what was initially like 30 probably pushes closer to about a hundred.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. And they're like a hundred feet away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Starting about a hundred feet away, slowly marching towards you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right where they are, I'm going to start a little ahead of where they originate, I'm going to start making an ice storm. I'm pushing all the way back to where-- just right down these fuckers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm also just trying to stay underneath her as best I can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stop looking up her skirt, brother.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is she in a skirt?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's been wearing a dress this whole time?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought she was covered in leaves.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stop looking up her fig leaf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. What's the damage on that? Is it 2d8 bludgeoning and 2d8--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They take 2d8 bludgeoning damage and 4d6 cold damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go ahead and roll for both. And it's a save for half, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Inspiration?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Well. I didn't do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 2d8 bludgeoning, that's seven bludgeoning... 4d6. Not great at all. Four, five, six, seven, eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total of eight. Eight plus... what was the other one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven, okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And it's difficult terrain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So the first area. Suddenly you see some of the clouds above you begin to funnel downward, and a few bolts of electricity (crackle) through it. As the funnel hits, it grows dark, and then all of a sudden this cold wind begins to swirl around it. And with that, the cloud almost seems to tear open within itself and a sheet of jagged ice and sleet begins to pour downward into the center of this undead horde. As it does, you can see probably a good 25, 30 of these are just blown apart, bone shards scattered around and you can see bits of rusted metal weapons and armor thrown left and right. The ice then coalesces over the floor of this area and some of the skeletons just slip, but they keep marching forward. It definitely took a chunk, but as it continues pushing forward--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Now we can run.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job. I grab the back of her shirt and yank her towards me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you get to the bottom of the tree, the zombie giant has taken notice of the sudden flashing of light and the movement in the tree and is bounding towards the tree after you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we running?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we going to the Alcove or going to the treeline?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I say we go to the treeline, and I say that you take a couple shots as we're heading--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm definitely doing that, yes. I'm going to shoot at the giant as we're running. Hunter's Mark him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you Hunter's Mark, turning around, looking at the giant.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As she says that, I'm going to go ahead and start casting my Call Lightning spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you land and you cast Call Lightning. The fog that you created, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Has formed up. You start seeing shapes; these terrifying skeletal faces begin to appear through the fog as the rest of the army begins to push through. The clouds coalescing above Keyleth as you get your Call Lightning ready, you marking the zombie giant, you guys begin bolting out of the way. Trinket comes running up behind you, Vex, and picks you up onto his back, and you guys begin rushing off toward the treeline-- to the west or the east?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I shoot him?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, as I turn around, I Call Lightning on the giant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and roll damage on that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And it's cloudy, so I get how much more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't know, how much do you get more on that? Call Lightning would be...

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: While you decide, which way are we going, Percy? West or east?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 3d10. It does an additional d10. It does 4d10.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I'm going to shoot him through my Longbow of the Sky Sentinel as we're going away, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So the passage to the castle I'm aware of is to the west, and then the one that Stonefell mentioned is to the east?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we go to the treeline by the castle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the one Stonefell mentioned was the same.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was the same?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It wasn't Stonefell, it was Vouk.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But yeah. He was referring to the same one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Treeline to the west so that we can attack first thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 22. Twice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then three on the last one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, it's technically 14 on the last one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For him? Still hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, sweet!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a big target. Big target, lot of hit points.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And as she's brewing up her bow, I'm behind her and just bring down the bolt for 32 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Damn. (lightning sound) You can see the bolt strikes the front of the zombie giant right as it starts swinging after you guys. The bolt hits its shoulder and blasts a chunk of its shoulder blade off. You see bone shards fire behind, and there's a giant piece of its torso now missing where the bolt hit. (groans) Stumbles back onto its back foot and catches itself, almost toppling over.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just start backing up. "Vex?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It starts lumbering forward again as Vex releases her arrow, which splits into three.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 54 points of damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kill it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice! (impact sounds) All the arrows blasting into its body, you can see they sink in and burst on the inside. There's a little, a dull glow as this burst of electrical energy hits from underneath its sickly zombified flesh. At which point, there's a slight delay before it (explosion sound) bubbles forth and a bit of its internal liquid just spews out like a boil. You can see it's definitely taking damage, and it keeps pushing forward. Yeah, it's still moving towards you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far away is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For gods' sakes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about ten feet from you guys right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I pull out Bad News. I'm shooting it with Bad News, and I'm going for an aimed shot to the legs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The moment it would take for you to stop and pull out Bad News, by the way, the moment you guys are turning around to attack it, it has gotten within range to hit, so this is all happening simultaneously, so it's going to get two strikes as you guys get your attacks, as well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. Go ahead and roll your attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you get?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 27 and an 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. And against Percy, that is a 17 and a 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 17 misses. The 20 hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You take 16 points of bludgeoning damage as its fist comes down and (whack) slams into your side just as Bad News fires off and your daggers go (dagger sounds) towards it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keen Dagger, Flametongue, combined 20 hit points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Good to know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And as soon as I'm able, I'm backing up and bringing down another lightning bolt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I've got another attack. That was just one attack that I did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You need your spells. We need to hide. We need to run.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can keep doing it. I'm not blowing spells on it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 22 points of damage, plus he's knocked prone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Easy enough. Through the daggers--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, he can make a con saving throw, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't matter. It still manages to keep its zombie form, though it seems like every single hit you're taking chunks off its body, but it continues to push through the damage until eventually it swings at you with the hit, Bad News goes off as it blasts through the center of its torso and takes out the back of its spine. It can't keep its physical form together, and as its body lunges forward, you throw both of your daggers, which go (thoonk thoonk) into each of its eyes. It falls forward. The torso seems to roll on impact and come after you like a slow-moving boulder for a few feet, but since you're all moving forward, you manage to outrun it, just barely keeping out of the way. The legs walk on their own for two more steps before it just falls forward into the mud, relieving all its intestines into the rain-soaked ground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's get out of here!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go, go, go. Run!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pass Without a Trace!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aggressive flower girl.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I see any other-- as we're running through--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just run, Keyleth!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I grab Keyleth by the arm and I just pull and run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys go running back and as you're looking over your shoulder you can see the skeletal army swarming the center of the square and pouring into the streets. It seems that the Briarwoods had their own reserve anti-riot campaign at the ready.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, are they going to take out everybody?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can't go, we can't go!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to go. We have nothing left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll be returning next week on that note.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) You son of a bitch, I love it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so we're going to take a little break here while we set up for Critmas. Quick one, very quick, we'll be back here in just a few minutes, for those who want to hang in and watch how ridiculously amazing this community is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh. There's like, there's a lot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you guys are crazy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Buckle up!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, quick break. See you in a second.
